story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in India, there was a kind and curious little girl named Meera. Meera loved to explore the world around her and learn new things. She would often wander through the fields and forests near her home, discovering all sorts of hidden treasures.

One day, as Meera was walking through the forest, she came across a beautiful butterfly with wings of the most vibrant colors she had ever seen. Meera was so fascinated by the butterfly that she decided to follow it, hoping to learn more about where it came from.

The butterfly led Meera deeper into the forest, to a hidden grove filled with the most amazing plants and flowers Meera had ever seen. She couldn't believe her eyes â€“ the leaves were shimmering with all the colors of the rainbow, and the flowers seemed to sing with the sweetest melodies.

As Meera wandered through the grove, she came across an old woman sitting on a rock. The woman was dressed in simple clothes, but she had a gentle and wise look about her. Meera approached her and asked if she knew anything about the magical grove.

The old woman smiled and told Meera that the grove was home to a special group of creatures known as the Flower Fairies. These fairies were responsible for tending to the plants and flowers, and their magic was what gave them their beautiful colors and enchanting melodies.

Meera was thrilled to hear this and asked if she could meet the Flower Fairies. The old woman nodded and led Meera to a small clearing, where a group of fairies were dancing and singing. Meera watched in amazement as the fairies flitted about, their wings leaving trails of glittering light behind them.

The old woman introduced Meera to the Flower Fairies and told them that Meera was a kind and curious girl who loved to learn new things. The fairies were delighted to meet Meera and invited her to join them in their dance.

Meera spent the rest of the afternoon dancing and singing with the Flower Fairies, learning all about their magic and the secrets of the grove. As the sun began to set, the old woman told Meera it was time to go home. Meera thanked the Flower Fairies and the old woman for the most magical day of her life.

From that day on, Meera visited the Flower Fairies every chance she got, and they became the best of friends. And even though she grew up and moved away from the village, Meera never forgot the magic of that special day in the forest, and she carried it with her always.

The end.

Good night my dear, sweet dreams!
